   19: %%
   20: -module(erlc_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Tests the erlc command by compiling various types of files.
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   26:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   27:          compile_erl/1,
   28:          compile_yecc/1, compile_script/1,
   29:          compile_mib/1, good_citizen/1, deep_cwd/1, arg_overflow/1,
   30:          make_dep_options/1,
   31:          unicode_paths/1,
   32:          features_erlc_describe/1,
   33:          features_erlc_unknown/1,
   34:          features_directives/1,
   35:          features_atom_warnings/1,
   36:          features_macros/1,
   37:          features_disable/1,
   38:          features_all/1,
   39:          features_load/1,
   40:          features_runtime/1,
   41:          features_include/1,
   42:          features/1]).
   43: 
   44: -import(lists, [sort/1]).
   45: 
   46: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   47: 
   48: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   49: 
   50: all() ->
   51:     [{group,with_server},{group,without_server},
   52:      {group,features_with_server}].
   53: 
   54: groups() ->
   55:     Tests = tests(),
   56:     [{with_server,[],Tests},
   57:      {features_with_server,[],feature_tests()},
   58:      {without_server,[],Tests ++ feature_tests()}].
   59: 
   60: tests() ->
   61:     [compile_erl, compile_yecc, compile_script, compile_mib,
   62:      good_citizen, deep_cwd, arg_overflow, make_dep_options,
   63:      unicode_paths].
   64: 
   65: feature_tests() ->
   66:     [features_erlc_describe,
   67:      features_erlc_unknown,
   68:      features_directives,
   69:      features_atom_warnings,
   70:      features_macros,
   71:      features_disable,
   72:      features_all,
   73:      features_load,
   74:      features_runtime,
   75:      features_include,
   76:      features].
   77: 
   78: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   79:     Config.
   80: 
   81: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   82:     ok.
   83: 
   84: init_per_group(with_server, Config) ->
   85:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "yes"),
   86:     Config;
   87: init_per_group(features_with_server, Config) ->
   88:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "yes"),
   89:     timer:sleep(12 * 1000),
   90:     Config;
   91: init_per_group(without_server, Config) ->
   92:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "no"),
   93:     Config;
   94: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
   95:     Config.
   96: 
   97: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   98:     os:unsetenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER"),
   99:     os:unsetenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES"),
  100:     Config.
  101: 
  102: init_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  103:     case lists:member(TestCase, feature_tests()) of
  104:         true ->
  105:             os:putenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES", "true");
  106:         false ->
  107:             ok
  108:         end,
  109:     Config.
  110: 
  111: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  112:     case lists:member(TestCase, feature_tests()) of
  113:         true ->
  114:             os:putenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES", "true");
  115:         false ->
  116:             ok
  117:         end,
  118:     Config.
  119: 
  120: 
  121: %% Copy from erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test.hrl.
  122: 
  123: -record(person, {name, shoe_size}).
  124: 
  125: %% Tests that compiling Erlang source code works.
  126: 
  127: compile_erl(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  128:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  129:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  130:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  131: 
  132:     %% By default, warnings are now turned on.
  133:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "",
  134:         ["Warning: function foo/0 is unused\$", "_OK_"]),
  135: 
  136:     %% Test that the compiled file is where it should be,
  137:     %% and that it is runnable.
  138: 
  139:     {module, erl_test_ok} = code:load_abs(filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok")),
  140:     42 = erl_test_ok:shoe_size(#person{shoe_size=42}),
  141:     code:purge(erl_test_ok),
  142: 
  143:     %% Try disabling warnings.
  144: 
  145:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W0", ["_OK_"]),
  146: 
  147:     %% Try treating warnings as errors.
  148: 
  149:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-Werror",
  150:         ["compile: warnings being treated as errors\$",
  151:          "function foo/0 is unused\$", "_ERROR_"]),
  152: 
  153:     %% Check a bad file.
  154: 
  155:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_bad.erl"),
  156:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "", ["function non_existing/1 undefined\$",
  157:                                    "_ERROR_"]),
  158:     ok.
  159: 
  160: %% Test that compiling yecc source code works.
  161: 
  162: compile_yecc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  163:     {SrcDir, _, OutDir} = get_dirs(Config),
  164:     Cmd = erlc() ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
  165:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "yecc_test_ok.yrl"),
  166:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W0", ["_OK_"]),
  167:     true = exists(filename:join(OutDir, "yecc_test_ok.erl")),
  168: 
  169:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "yecc_test_bad.yrl"),
  170:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "-W0",
  171:         ["Nonterminals is missing\$",
  172:          "rootsymbol form is not a nonterminal\$",
  173:          "undefined nonterminal: form\$",
  174:          "_ERROR_"]),
  175:     exists(filename:join(OutDir, "yecc_test_ok.erl")),
  176:     ok.
  177: 
  178: %% Test that compiling start scripts works.
  179: 
  180: compile_script(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  181:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  182:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "start_ok.script"),
  183:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  184:     true = exists(filename:join(OutDir, "start_ok.boot")),
  185: 
  186:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "start_bad.script"),
  187:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "", ["syntax error before:", "_ERROR_"]),
  188:     ok.
  189: 
  190: %% Test that compiling SNMP mibs works.
  191: 
  192: compile_mib(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  193:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  194:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "GOOD-MIB.mib"),
  195:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  196:     Output = filename:join(OutDir, "GOOD-MIB.bin"),
  197:     true = exists(Output),
  198: 
  199:     %% Try -W option.
  200: 
  201:     ok = file:delete(Output),
  202:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W",
  203:         ["_OK_"]),
  204:     true = exists(Output),
  205: 
  206:     %% Try -W option and more verbose.
  207: 
  208:     ok = file:delete(Output),
  209:     case os:type() of
  210:         {unix,_} ->
  211:             run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W +'{verbosity,info}'",
  212:                 ["\\[GOOD-MIB[.]mib\\]\\[INF\\]: No accessfunction for 'sysDescr' => using default",
  213:                  "_OK_"]),
  214:             true = exists(Output),
  215:             ok = file:delete(Output);
  216:         _ -> ok				%Don't bother -- too much work.
  217:     end,
  218: 
  219:     %% Try a bad file.
  220: 
  221:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "BAD-MIB.mib"),
  222:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "",
  223:         ["BAD-MIB.mib: 1: syntax error before: mibs\$",
  224:          "compilation_failed_ERROR_"]),
  225: 
  226:     %% Make sure that no -I option works.
  227: 
  228:     NewCmd = erlc() ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
  229:     run(Config, NewCmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  230:     true = exists(Output),
  231: 
  232:     ok.
  233: 
  234: %% Checks that 'erlc' doesn't eat any input (important when called from a
  235: %% shell script with redirected input).
  236: good_citizen(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  237:     case os:type() of
  238:         {unix, _} ->
  239:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  240:             Answer = filename:join(PrivDir, "answer"),
  241:             Script = filename:join(PrivDir, "test_script"),
  242:             Test = filename:join(PrivDir, "test.erl"),
  243:             S = ["#! /bin/sh\n", "erlc ", Test, "\n",
  244:                  "read reply\n", "echo $reply\n"],
  245:             ok = file:write_file(Script, S),
  246:             ok = file:write_file(Test, "-module(test).\n"),
  247:             Cmd = "echo y | sh " ++ Script ++ " > " ++ Answer,
  248:             os:cmd(Cmd),
  249:             {ok, Answer0} = file:read_file(Answer),
  250:             [$y|_] = binary_to_list(Answer0),
  251:             ok;
  252:         _ ->
  253:             {skip, "Unix specific"}
  254:     end.
  255: 
  256: %% Make sure that compiling an Erlang module deep down in
  257: %% in a directory with more than 255 characters works.
  258: deep_cwd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  259:     case os:type() of
  260:         {unix, _} ->
  261:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  262:             deep_cwd_1(PrivDir);
  263:         _ ->
  264:             {skip, "Only a problem on Unix"}
  265:     end.
  266: 
  267: deep_cwd_1(PrivDir) ->
  268:     DeepDir0 = filename:join(PrivDir, lists:duplicate(128, $a)),
  269:     DeepDir = filename:join(DeepDir0, lists:duplicate(128, $b)),
  270:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(DeepDir,"any_file")),
  271:     ok = file:set_cwd(DeepDir),
  272:     ok = file:write_file("test.erl", "-module(test).\n\n"),
  273:     io:format("~s\n", [os:cmd("erlc test.erl")]),
  274:     true = filelib:is_file("test.beam"),
  275:     ok.
  276: 
  277: %% Test that a large number of command line switches does not
  278: %% overflow the argument buffer
  279: arg_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  280:     {SrcDir, _OutDir, Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  281:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  282:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  283:     %% Each -D option will be expanded to three arguments when
  284:     %% invoking 'erl'.
  285:     NumDOptions = num_d_options(),
  286:     Args = lists:flatten([ ["-D", integer_to_list(N, 36), "=1 "] ||
  287:                            N <- lists:seq(1, NumDOptions) ]),
  288:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, Args,
  289:         ["Warning: function foo/0 is unused\$",
  290:          "_OK_"]),
  291:     ok.
  292: 
  293: num_d_options() ->
  294:     case {os:type(),os:version()} of
  295:         {{win32,_},_} ->
  296:             %% The maximum size of a command line in the command
  297:             %% shell on Windows is 8191 characters.
  298:             %% Each -D option is expanded to "@dv NN 1", i.e.
  299:             %% 8 characters. (Numbers up to 1295 can be expressed
  300:             %% as two 36-base digits.)
  301:             1000;
  302:         {{unix,linux},Version} when Version < {2,6,23} ->
  303:             %% On some older 64-bit versions of Linux, the maximum number
  304:             %% of arguments is 16383.
  305:             %% See: http://www.in-ulm.de/~mascheck/various/argmax/
  306:             5440;
  307:         {{unix,darwin},{Major,_,_}} when Major >= 11 ->
  308:             %% "getconf ARG_MAX" still reports 262144 (as in previous
  309:             %% version of MacOS X), but the useful space seem to have
  310:             %% shrunk significantly (or possibly the number of arguments).
  311:             %% 7673
  312:             7500;
  313:         {_,_} ->
  314:             12000
  315:     end.
  316: 
  317: erlc() ->
  318:     case os:find_executable("erlc") of
  319:         false ->
  320:             ct:fail("Can't find erlc");
  321:         Erlc ->
  322:             "\"" ++ Erlc ++ "\""
  323:     end.
  324: 
  325: make_dep_options(Config) ->
  326:     {SrcDir,OutDir,Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  327:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  328:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  329:     BeamFileName = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.beam"),
  330: 
  331:     DepRE = ["/erl_test_ok[.]beam: \\\\$",
  332:              "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  333:              "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  334:              "_OK_"],
  335: 
  336:     DepRETarget =
  337:     ["^target: \\\\$",
  338:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  339:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  340:      "_OK_"],
  341: 
  342:     DepREMP =
  343:     ["/erl_test_ok[.]beam: \\\\$",
  344:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  345:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  346:      [],
  347:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test.hrl:$",
  348:      "_OK_"],
  349: 
  350:     DepREMissing =
  351:     ["/erl_test_missing_header[.]beam: \\\\$",
  352:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_missing_header[.]erl \\\\$",
  353:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl \\\\$",
  354:      "missing.hrl$",
  355:      "_OK_"],
  356: 
  357:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  358: 
  359:     %% Test plain -M
  360:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M", DepRE),
  361:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  362: 
  363:     %% Test -MF File
  364:     DepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "my.deps"),
  365:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MF "++DepFile, ["_OK_"]),
  366:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(DepFile),
  367:     verify_result(binary_to_list(MFBin)++["_OK_"], DepRE),
  368:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  369: 
  370:     %% Test -MD
  371:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MD", ["_OK_"]),
  372:     MDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  373:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(MDFile),
  374:     file:delete(MDFile), %% used further down!
  375:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  376: 
  377:     %% Test -M -MT Target
  378:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MT target", DepRETarget),
  379:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  380: 
  381:     %% Test -MF File -MT Target
  382:     TargetDepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "target.deps"),
  383:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MF "++TargetDepFile++" -MT target",
  384:         ["_OK_"]),
  385:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetDepFile),
  386:     verify_result(binary_to_list(TargetBin)++["_OK_"], DepRETarget),
  387:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  388:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  389: 
  390:     %% Test -MD -MT Target
  391:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MD -MT target", ["_OK_"]),
  392:     TargetMDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  393:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetMDFile),
  394:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  395:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  396: 
  397:     %% Test -M -MQ Target. (Note: Passing a $ on the command line
  398:     %% portably for Unix and Windows is tricky, so we will just test
  399:     %% that MQ works at all.)
  400:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MQ target", DepRETarget),
  401:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  402: 
  403:     %% Test -M -MP
  404:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MP", DepREMP),
  405:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  406: 
  407:     %% Test -M -MG
  408:     MissingHeader = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_missing_header.erl"),
  409:     run(Config, Cmd, MissingHeader, "-M -MG", DepREMissing),
  410:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  411: 
  412:     %%
  413:     %% check the above variants with side-effect -MMD
  414:     %%
  415: 
  416:     %% since compiler is run on the erlang code a warning will be
  417:     %% issued by the compiler, match that.
  418:     WarningRE =
  419:          "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok.erl:[0-9]+:[0-9]+: "
  420:         "Warning: function foo/0 is unused$",
  421:     ErrorRE = "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_missing_header.erl:"
  422:         "[0-9]+:[0-9]+: can't find include file \"missing.hrl\"$",
  423: 
  424:     DepRE_MMD = insert_before("_OK_", WarningRE, DepRE),
  425:     DepRETarget_MMD = insert_before("_OK_", WarningRE, DepRETarget),
  426:     DepREMP_MMD = insert_before("_OK_",WarningRE,DepREMP),
  427:     DepREMissing_MMD = (insert_before("_OK_",ErrorRE,DepREMissing)--
  428:                             ["_OK_"]) ++ ["_ERROR_"],
  429:     CompRE = [WarningRE,"_OK_"],
  430: 
  431: 
  432:     %% Test plain -MMD -M
  433:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M", DepRE_MMD),
  434:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  435:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  436: 
  437:     %% Test -MMD -MF File
  438:     DepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "my.deps"),
  439:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MF "++DepFile, CompRE),
  440:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(DepFile),
  441:     verify_result(binary_to_list(MFBin)++["_OK_"], DepRE),
  442:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  443:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  444: 
  445:     %% Test -MMD -MD
  446:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MD", CompRE),
  447:     MDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  448:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(MDFile),
  449:     file:delete(MDFile), %% used further down!
  450:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  451:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  452: 
  453:     %% Test -MMD -M -MT Target
  454:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MT target", DepRETarget_MMD),
  455:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  456:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  457: 
  458:     %% Test -MMD -MF File -MT Target
  459:     TargetDepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "target.deps"),
  460:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MF "++TargetDepFile++" -MT target",
  461:         CompRE),
  462:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetDepFile),
  463:     verify_result(binary_to_list(TargetBin)++["_OK_"], DepRETarget),
  464:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  465:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  466:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  467: 
  468:     %% Test -MMD -MD -MT Target
  469:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MD -MT target", CompRE),
  470:     TargetMDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  471:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetMDFile),
  472:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  473:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  474:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  475: 
  476:     %% Test -MMD -M -MQ Target. (Note: Passing a $ on the command line
  477:     %% portably for Unix and Windows is tricky, so we will just test
  478:     %% that MQ works at all.)
  479:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MQ target", DepRETarget_MMD),
  480:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  481:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  482: 
  483:     %% Test -MMD -M -MP
  484:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MP", DepREMP_MMD),
  485:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  486:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  487: 
  488:     %% Test -MMD -M -MG
  489:     MissingHeader = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_missing_header.erl"),
  490:     run(Config, Cmd, MissingHeader, "-MMD -M -MG", DepREMissing_MMD),
  491:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  492:     ok.
  493: 
  494: unicode_paths(Config) ->
  495:     case {os:type(), file:native_name_encoding()} of
  496:         {{win32,_}, _} -> {skip, "Unicode paths not supported on windows"};
  497:         {_,latin1} -> {skip, "Cannot interpret unicode filenames when native_name_encoding is latin1"};
  498:         _ ->
  499:             DepRE = ["_OK_"],
  500:             {SrcDir,OutDir0,Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  501:             OutDir = filename:join(OutDir0,"😀"),
  502:             ok = case file:make_dir(OutDir) of
  503:                 {error, eexist} -> ok;
  504:                 ok -> ok;
  505:                 E -> E
  506:             end,
  507:             Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief -o "++OutDir,
  508:             FileName = filename:join([SrcDir, "😀", "erl_test_unicode.erl"]),
  509:             BeamFileName = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_unicode.beam"),
  510:             run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "", DepRE),
  511:             true = exists(BeamFileName),
  512:             file:delete(BeamFileName),
  513:             file:delete(OutDir),
  514:             ok
  515:     end.
  516: 
  517: %%% Tests related to the features mechanism
  518: %% Support macros and functions
  519: -define(OK(Lines), Lines ++ ["_OK_"]).
  520: -define(NOTOK(Lines), Lines ++ ["_ERROR_"]).
  521: 
  522: flatfmt(FStr, Args) ->
  523:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format(FStr, Args)).
  524: 
  525: defopt(Name) -> flatfmt("-D~w", [Name]).
  526: defopt(Name, Value) -> flatfmt("-D~w=~w", [Name, Value]).
  527: 
  528: longopt(enable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("-enable-feature ~w", [Ftr]);
  529: longopt(disable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("-disable-feature ~w", [Ftr]).
  530: 
  531: plusopt(enable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("+\"{feature, ~w, enable}\"", [Ftr]);
  532: plusopt(disable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("+\"{feature, ~w, disable}\"", [Ftr]).
  533: 
  534: options(Opts) -> lists:flatten(lists:join(" ", Opts)).
  535: 
  536: peer(Args) ->
  537:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
  538:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args,
  539:                    connection => 0}),
  540:     {Peer, Node}.
  541: 
  542: %% Error messages to expect
  543: nosingle(Ftr) -> flatfmt("the feature '~w' does not exist", [Ftr]).
  544: 
  545: nomultiple(Ftrs) ->
  546:     Q = fun(A) -> flatfmt("'~w'", [A]) end,
  547:     flatfmt("the features ~s and '~w' do not exist",
  548:             [lists:join(", ",
  549:                         lists:map(Q, lists:droplast(Ftrs))),
  550:              lists:last(Ftrs)]).
  551: 
  552: not_config(Ftr) -> flatfmt("the feature '~w' is not configurable", [Ftr]).
  553: 
  554: syntax(Offender) -> flatfmt("syntax error before: ~w", [Offender]).
  555: 
  556: misplaced_directive() ->
  557:     "feature directive not allowed after exports or record definitions".
  558: 
  559: atom_warning(Atom, Ftr) ->
  560:     flatfmt("atom '~w' is reserved in the experimental feature '~w'",
  561:             [Atom, Ftr]).
  562: 
  563: compile_fun(Config) ->
  564:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  565:     Compile = fun(FName, Opts, Expected) ->
  566:                       Path = case FName of
  567:                                  "" -> "";
  568:                                  FName -> filename:join(SrcDir, FName)
  569:                              end,
  570:                       run(Config, Cmd, Path, Opts, Expected)
  571:               end,
  572:     {Compile, SrcDir, OutDir}.
  573: 
  574: %% Tests
  575: features_erlc_describe(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  576:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  577: 
  578:     Compile("", "-list-features",
  579:             ?NOTOK(["Available features:",
  580:                     "approved_ftr_1",
  581:                     "approved_ftr_2",
  582:                     "experimental_ftr_1",
  583:                     "experimental_ftr_2"])),
  584: 
  585:     Compile("", "-describe-feature experimental_ftr_1",
  586:             ?NOTOK(["experimental_ftr_1",
  587:                     "Type",
  588:                     "Status",
  589:                     "Keywords",
  590:                     skip_lines])),
  591: 
  592:     Compile("", "-describe-feature loop_macro",
  593:             ?NOTOK(["Unknown feature: loop_macro"])).
  594: 
  595: features_erlc_unknown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  596:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  597: 
  598:     %% Test for single invalid feature, using long and +options
  599:     Compile("nofile.erl", longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  600:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  601:     Compile("nofile.erl", plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  602:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  603:     Compile("nofile.erl", longopt(disable, no_ftr),
  604:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  605:     Compile("nofile.erl", plusopt(disable, no_ftr),
  606:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  607: 
  608:     %% Test for multiple invalid features
  609:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  610:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  611:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  612:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  613:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr),
  614:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  615:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  616:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  617:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  618:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  619:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  620:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  621:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  622:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  623: 
  624:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  625:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  626:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  627:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  628:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  629:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  630: 
  631:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  632:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr),
  633:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  634:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  635:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  636:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  637:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  638:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  639: 
  640:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  641:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  642:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  643:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  644:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  645:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  646:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  647:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  648: 
  649:     %% Rejected and permanent features can not be configured.
  650:     %% Rejected feature
  651:     Compile("nofile.erl",
  652:             options([longopt(enable, rejected_ftr)]),
  653:             ?NOTOK([not_config(rejected_ftr),
  654:                     skip_lines])),
  655: 
  656:     %% Permanent feature
  657:     Compile("nofile.erl",
  658:             options([longopt(enable, permanent_ftr)]),
  659:             ?NOTOK([not_config(permanent_ftr),
  660:                     skip_lines])).
  661: 
  662: features_directives(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  663:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  664: 
  665:     %% Test for misplaced feature directive (enable)
  666:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  667:             options([defopt(misplaced_enable)]),
  668:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
  669:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature.*misplaced",
  670:                     skip_lines])),
  671:     %% Test for misplaced feature directive (disable)
  672:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  673:             options([defopt(misplaced_disable)]),
  674:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
  675:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature.*misplaced",
  676:                     skip_lines])),
  677: 
  678:     %% Test for unknown feature in directive (enable)
  679:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  680:             options([defopt(enable_unknown)]),
  681:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(unlesser),
  682:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature",
  683:                     skip_lines])),
  684:     %% Test for unknown feature in directive (disable)
  685:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  686:             options([defopt(disable_unknown)]),
  687:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(unlesser),
  688:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature",
  689:                     skip_lines])),
  690: 
  691:     %% Enable a feature on the command line and disable the same in a
  692:     %% directive
  693:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  694:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  695:                      defopt(disable_exp2),
  696:                      defopt(no_dir_enable_exp2)]),
  697:             ?OK([])).
  698: 
  699: features_atom_warnings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  700:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  701: 
  702:     %% Check for keyword warnings.  Not all are checked.
  703:     Compile("ignorant.erl", "+warn_keywords",
  704:             ?OK([atom_warning(until, experimental_ftr_2),
  705:                  skip_lines,
  706:                  atom_warning(ifn, experimental_ftr_1),
  707:                  skip_lines,
  708:                  atom_warning(while, experimental_ftr_2),
  709:                  skip_lines])),
  710: 
  711:     %% Check for keyword warnings, resulting in error.
  712:     %% Not all warnings are checked.
  713:     Compile("ignorant.erl", "+warn_keywords -Werror",
  714:             ?NOTOK([skip_lines,
  715:                     atom_warning(until, experimental_ftr_2),
  716:                     skip_lines,
  717:                     atom_warning(ifn, experimental_ftr_1),
  718:                     skip_lines,
  719:                     atom_warning(while, experimental_ftr_2),
  720:                     skip_lines])),
  721: 
  722:     %% File has quoted atoms which are keywords in experimental_ftr_2.
  723:     %% We should see no warnings.
  724:     Compile("foo.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  725:                                 "+warn_keywords"]),
  726:             ?OK([])).
  727: 
  728: features(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  729:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  730: 
  731:     %% Simple compile - baseline for this file.  Really needed?
  732:     %% It uses atoms that are keywords in  experimental features.
  733:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  734:             [],
  735:             ?OK([])),
  736: 
  737:     %% Enable and disable the same feature on the command line to
  738:     %% check that the ordering semantics is honoured.
  739:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  740:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  741:                      longopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  742:             ?OK([])),
  743: 
  744:     %% As above, with +options
  745:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  746:             options([plusopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  747:                      plusopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  748:             ?OK([])),
  749: 
  750:     %% Mixed options
  751:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  752:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  753:                      plusopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  754:             ?OK([])),
  755: 
  756:     %% Mixed options
  757:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  758:             options([plusopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  759:                      longopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  760:             ?OK([])),
  761: 
  762:     %% Enable a feature and see errors
  763:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  764:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  765:             ?NOTOK([syntax(ifn),
  766:                     skip_lines,
  767:                     syntax(ifn),
  768:                     skip_lines])),
  769: 
  770:     %% Enable another feature and see other errors
  771:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  772:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  773:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
  774:                     skip_lines,
  775:                     syntax(until),
  776:                     skip_lines,
  777:                     syntax(while),
  778:                     skip_lines,
  779:                     syntax(while),
  780:                     skip_lines,
  781:                     syntax(until),
  782:                     skip_lines])),
  783: 
  784:     %% Enable both features and see even more errors
  785:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  786:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  787:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  788:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
  789:                     skip_lines,
  790:                     syntax(until),
  791:                     skip_lines,
  792:                     syntax(ifn),
  793:                     skip_lines,
  794:                     syntax(while),
  795:                     skip_lines,
  796:                     syntax(until),
  797:                     skip_lines,
  798:                     syntax(ifn),
  799:                     skip_lines])),
  800: 
  801:     ok.
  802: 
  803: features_macros(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  804:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  805: 
  806:     Compile("f_macros.erl", "", ?OK([])),
  807: 
  808:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  809:     Call = fun(Node, Fun) ->
  810:                    erpc:call(Node, f_macros, Fun, [])
  811:            end,
  812: 
  813:     {module, f_macros} =
  814:         erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  815: 
  816:     true = Call(Node0, has_experimental),
  817:     false = Call(Node0, has_hindley_milner),
  818:     false = Call(Node0, with_hm),
  819:     false = Call(Node0, uses_experimental),
  820:     false = Call(Node0, uses_exp2),
  821: 
  822:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  823: 
  824:     Compile("f_macros.erl", longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  825:             ?OK([])),
  826: 
  827:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  828: 
  829:     true = erpc:call(Node1, erlang, module_loaded, [erl_features]),
  830: 
  831:     %% Starting from OTP 26, compile-time features don't need to be
  832:     %% enabled in the runtime system.
  833:     {module, f_macros} =
  834:         erpc:call(Node1, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  835:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  836:     [approved_ftr_1, approved_ftr_2, experimental_ftr_1] =
  837:         sort(erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, used, [f_macros])),
  838: 
  839:     peer:stop(Peer1),
  840: 
  841:     %% Restart with feature enabled in runtime
  842:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  843:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1"]),
  844:     %% Now we can load it
  845:     {module, f_macros} =
  846:         erpc:call(Node2, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  847: 
  848:     true = Call(Node2, uses_experimental),
  849:     false = Call(Node2, uses_exp2),
  850:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  851: 
  852:     Compile("f_macros.erl", longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  853:             ?OK([])),
  854:     {Peer3, Node3} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  855:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  856:     false = Call(Node3, uses_experimental),
  857:     true = Call(Node3, uses_exp2),
  858:     peer:stop(Peer3),
  859: 
  860:     Compile("f_macros.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  861:                                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  862:             ?OK([])),
  863:     {Peer4, Node4} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  864:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1",
  865:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  866:     true = Call(Node4, uses_experimental),
  867:     true = Call(Node4, uses_exp2),
  868:     peer:stop(Peer4),
  869: 
  870:     ok.
  871: 
  872: features_disable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  873:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  874: 
  875:     Call = fun(Node, Fun) ->
  876:                    erpc:call(Node, f_disable, Fun, [])
  877:            end,
  878: 
  879:     Compile("f_disable.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  880:                                       longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  881:             ?OK([])),
  882: 
  883:     {Peer, Node} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  884:                          "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1",
  885:                          "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  886:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  887:     [approved_ftr_2] =
  888:         erpc:call(Node, erl_features, used, [f_disable]),
  889: 
  890:     no_experimental = Call(Node, no_experimental),
  891:     no_exp2 = Call(Node, no_ftrs),
  892:     peer:stop(Peer),
  893: 
  894:     ok.
  895: 
  896: features_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  897:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  898: 
  899:     Compile("foo.erl", longopt(enable, all),
  900:             ?OK([])),
  901: 
  902:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  903:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  904:     [approved_ftr_1,approved_ftr_2,experimental_ftr_1,experimental_ftr_2] =
  905:         sort(erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [foo])),
  906:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  907: 
  908:     Compile("foo.erl", longopt(disable, all),
  909:             ?OK([])),
  910: 
  911:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  912:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  913:     [] = erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, used, [foo]),
  914:     {module, foo} = erpc:call(Node1, code, load_file, [foo]),
  915:     peer:stop(Peer1),
  916: 
  917:     Compile("foo.erl", options([longopt(disable, all),
  918:                                 longopt(enable, approved_ftr_2)]),
  919:             ?OK([])),
  920: 
  921:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  922:                            "-disable-feature", "all"]),
  923:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  924:     [approved_ftr_2] = erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, used, [foo]),
  925:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  926: 
  927:     ok.
  928: 
  929: features_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  930:     {_Compile, SrcDir, _OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  931: 
  932:     %% Note that we put SrcDir in the load path as there is where we
  933:     %% have the precompiled beam file.
  934:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", SrcDir]),
  935: 
  936:     %% For a file compiled with an older version, i.e., with no Meta
  937:     %% chunk, we should see no used features.
  938:     [] = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [older]),
  939:     %% .. and we should be able to load it.
  940:     {module,older} = erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [older]),
  941: 
  942:     [] = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used,
  943:                    [filename:join(SrcDir, "older.beam")]),
  944: 
  945:     %% Behaviour for non existent modules
  946:     not_found = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [none]),
  947:     not_found = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, ["none.beam"]),
  948:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  949: 
  950:     ok.
  951: 
  952: features_runtime(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  953:     AllFtrs = [approved_ftr_1,
  954:                approved_ftr_2,
  955:                experimental_ftr_1,
  956:                experimental_ftr_2,
  957:                permanent_ftr,
  958:                rejected_ftr],
  959:     ConfigFtrs = [approved_ftr_1,
  960:                   approved_ftr_2,
  961:                   experimental_ftr_1,
  962:                   experimental_ftr_2],
  963:     Approved = [approved_ftr_2,
  964:                 approved_ftr_1],
  965: 
  966:     {_Compile, _SrcDir, _OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  967: 
  968:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer([]),
  969: 
  970:     %% Get all known features
  971:     AllFtrs = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, all, []),
  972:     ConfigFtrs = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, configurable, []),
  973:     Approved =  erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, enabled, []),
  974: 
  975:     %% Keywords from enabled (here the approved) features
  976:     %% (does not need to be quoted since it comes from the peer node)
  977:     [unless] =  erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, keywords, []),
  978: 
  979:     Info = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, info, [permanent_ftr]),
  980:     true = is_map(Info),
  981:     true = lists:all(fun(K) -> is_map_key(K, Info) end,
  982:                      [status,type,description,short,experimental]),
  983: 
  984:     %% Try to get info for unknown feature - raises error
  985:     try
  986:         erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, info, [unknown_feature]) of
  987:         Value ->
  988:             ct:fail({value_returned_for_unknown_feature, Value})
  989:     catch
  990:         error:{exception, invalid_feature, _} ->
  991:             ok;
  992:         Class:Reason ->
  993:             ct:fail({unexpected_exception, {Class, Reason}})
  994:     end,
  995: 
  996:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  997: 
  998:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_2"]),
  999:     [approved_ftr_1, approved_ftr_2, experimental_ftr_2] =
 1000:         sort(erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, enabled, [])),
 1001:     [while, until, unless] =  erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, keywords, []),
 1002: 
 1003:     peer:stop(Peer1),
 1004: 
 1005:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-disable-feature", "all"]),
 1006:     [] = erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, enabled, []),
 1007:     [] =  erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, keywords, []),
 1008: 
 1009:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1010:     ok.
 1011: 
 1012: features_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1013:     {Compile, _SrcDir, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
 1014: 
 1015:     %% Ensure that the feature experimental_ftr_1 is enabled in the
 1016:     %% include file and generates an error
 1017:     Compile("f_include_1.erl", [],
 1018:             ?NOTOK([syntax(ifn),
 1019:                     skip_lines])),
 1020: 
 1021:     %% This will disable a feature after a record has been defined.
 1022:     %% Error expected
 1023:     Compile("f_include_1.erl", defopt(end_include),
 1024:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
 1025:                     skip_lines])),
 1026: 
 1027:     %% Ensure that the macro knows that experimental_ftr_1 is enabled
 1028:     %% in the include file.
 1029:     Compile("f_include_2.erl", defopt(end_include),
 1030:             ?OK([])),
 1031: 
 1032:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1033:                            "-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_1"]),
 1034: 
 1035:     {module, f_include_2} = erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [f_include_2]),
 1036:     active = erpc:call(Node0, f_include_2, foo, [2]),
 1037:     peer:stop(Peer0),
 1038: 
 1039:     Compile("f_include_3.erl", [],
 1040:             ?OK([])),
 1041: 
 1042:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1043:                            "-enable-feature", "all"]),
 1044:     exp2_enabled = erpc:call(Node1, f_include_3, foo, [1]),
 1045:     peer:stop(Peer1),
 1046: 
 1047:     Compile("f_include_3.erl", defopt(end_prefix),
 1048:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
 1049:                     "experimental_ftr_2",
 1050:                     skip_lines])),
 1051: 
 1052:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl", defopt(enable_exp_2, 0),
 1053:             ?OK([])),
 1054:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
 1055:     {conditional, on, until} = erpc:call(Node2, f_include_exp2, foo, []),
 1056:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1057: 
 1058:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1059:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 0),
 1060:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
 1061:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
 1062:                     skip_lines])),
 1063: 
 1064:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1065:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 1)]),
 1066:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
 1067:                     skip_lines])),
 1068: 
 1069:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1070:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 2),
 1071:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
 1072:             ?OK([])),
 1073: 
 1074:     {Peer3, Node3} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1075:                            "-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_2"]),
 1076:     {conditional, off, none} = erpc:call(Node3, f_include_exp2, foo, []),
 1077: 
 1078:     [approved_ftr_1, approved_ftr_2, experimental_ftr_2] =
 1079:         sort(erpc:call(Node3, erl_features, used, [f_include_exp2])),
 1080:     peer:stop(Peer3),
 1081: 
 1082:     ok.
 1083: 
 1084: %% Runs a command.
 1085: 
 1086: run(Config, Cmd0, Name, Options, Expect) ->
 1087:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " " ++ Options ++ " " ++ Name,
 1088:     io:format("~ts", [Cmd]),
 1089:     Result = run_command(Config, Cmd),
 1090:     verify_result(Result, Expect).
 1091: 
 1092: verify_result(Result, Expect) ->
 1093:     Messages = split(Result, [], []),
 1094:     io:format("Result: ~p", [Messages]),
 1095:     io:format("Expected: ~p", [Expect]),
 1096:     match_messages_x(Messages, Expect).
 1097: 
 1098: %% insert What before Item, crash if Item is not found
 1099: insert_before(Item, What, [Item|List]) ->
 1100:     [What,Item|List];
 1101: insert_before(Item, What, [Other|List]) ->
 1102:     [Other|insert_before(Item, What, List)].
 1103: 
 1104: split([$\n|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1105:     split(Rest, [], [lists:reverse(Current)|Lines]);
 1106: split([$\r|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1107:     split(Rest, Current, Lines);
 1108: split([Char|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1109:     split(Rest, [Char|Current], Lines);
 1110: split([], [], Lines) ->
 1111:     lists:reverse(Lines);
 1112: split([], Current, Lines) ->
 1113:     split([], [], [lists:reverse(Current)|Lines]).
 1114: 
 1115: match_messages_x(Msgs0, Regexps0) ->
 1116:     Msgs = lists:droplast(Msgs0),
 1117:     Regexps = lists:droplast(Regexps0),
 1118:     Return = lists:last(Msgs0),
 1119:     ExpRet = lists:last(Regexps0),
 1120:     match_messages(Msgs, Regexps),
 1121:     match_one(Return, ExpRet).
 1122: 
 1123: match_messages(_, [skip_lines]) ->
 1124:     ok;
 1125: match_messages([_Msg|Rest1], [skip_one|Rest2]) ->
 1126:     match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1127: match_messages([Msg|Rest1], [skip_lines, Regexp|Rest2]) ->
 1128:     case match(Msg, Regexp) of
 1129:         match ->
 1130:             match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1131:         nomatch ->
 1132:             match_messages(Rest1, [skip_lines, Regexp|Rest2])
 1133:     end;
 1134: match_messages([Msg|Rest1], [Regexp|Rest2]) ->
 1135:     match_one(Msg, Regexp),
 1136:     match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1137: match_messages([], [Expect|Rest]) ->
 1138:     ct:fail({too_few_messages, [Expect|Rest]});
 1139: match_messages([Msg|Rest], []) ->
 1140:     ct:fail({too_many_messages, [Msg|Rest]});
 1141: match_messages([], []) ->
 1142:     ok.
 1143: 
 1144: match_one(Msg, Regexp) ->
 1145:     case match(Msg, Regexp) of
 1146:         match ->
 1147:             ok;
 1148:         nomatch ->
 1149:             io:format("Not matching: ~s\n", [Msg]),
 1150:             io:format("Regexp      : ~s\n", [Regexp]),
 1151:             ct:fail(message_mismatch)
 1152:     end.
 1153: 
 1154: match(Msg, Regexp) ->
 1155:     re:run(Msg, Regexp, [{capture,none}, unicode]).
 1156: 
 1157: get_cmd(Cfg) ->
 1158:     {SrcDir, IncDir, OutDir} = get_dirs(Cfg),
 1159:     Cmd = erlc() ++ " -I" ++ IncDir ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
 1160:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd}.
 1161: 
 1162: get_dirs(Cfg) ->
 1163:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Cfg),
 1164:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Cfg),
 1165:     SrcDir = filename:join(DataDir, "src"),
 1166:     IncDir = filename:join(DataDir, "include"),
 1167:     {SrcDir, IncDir, PrivDir}.
 1168: 
 1169: exists(Name) ->
 1170:     filelib:is_file(Name).
 1171: 
 1172: %% Runs the command using os:cmd/1.
 1173: %%
 1174: %% Returns the output from the command (as a list of characters with
 1175: %% embedded newlines).  The very last line will indicate the
 1176: %% exit status of the command, where _OK_ means zero, and _ERROR_
 1177: %% a non-zero exit status.
 1178: 
 1179: run_command(Config, Cmd) ->
 1180:     TmpDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "tmp"),
 1181:     file:make_dir(TmpDir),
 1182:     {RunFile, Run, Script} = run_command(TmpDir, os:type(), Cmd),
 1183:     ok = file:write_file(RunFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(Script)),
 1184:     os:cmd(Run).
 1185: 
 1186: run_command(Dir, {win32, _}, Cmd) ->
 1187:     BatchFile = filename:join(Dir, "run.bat"),
 1188:     Run = re:replace(filename:rootname(BatchFile), "/", "\\",
 1189:                      [global,{return,list}]),
 1190:     {BatchFile,
 1191:      Run,
 1192:      ["@echo off\r\n",
 1193:       "set ERLC_EMULATOR=", os:find_executable("erl"), "\r\n",
 1194:       Cmd, "\r\n",
 1195:       "if errorlevel 1 echo _ERROR_\r\n",
 1196:       "if not errorlevel 1 echo _OK_\r\n"]};
 1197: run_command(Dir, {unix, _}, Cmd) ->
 1198:     Name = filename:join(Dir, "run"),
 1199:     {Name,
 1200:      "/bin/sh " ++ Name,
 1201:      ["#!/bin/sh\n",
 1202:       "ERLC_EMULATOR='",  os:find_executable("erl"), "'\n",
 1203:       "export ERLC_EMULATOR\n",
 1204:       Cmd, "\n",
 1205:       "case $? in\n",
 1206:       "  0) echo '_OK_';;\n",
 1207:       "  *) echo '_ERROR_';;\n",
 1208:       "esac\n"]};
 1209: run_command(_Dir, Other, _Cmd) ->
 1210:     ct:fail("Don't know how to test exit code for ~p", [Other]).
